rxy 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference

    rxy

    rxy.Rmd

    The rxy package helps compute and explore correlations between variables.

    The package has one main function to screen out predictor variables that have a non-significant relationship with the outcome variable in the specified formula.

    library(rxy)

# Correlate medv with the rest of the variables in the Boston dataset

library(MASS)

x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv")

# Print results
print(x)
#> Correlations of medv with
#>  variable      r        p sigif
#>     lstat -0.738  < 2e-16   ***
#>        rm  0.695  < 2e-16   ***
#>   ptratio -0.508  < 2e-16   ***
#>     indus -0.484  < 2e-16   ***
#>       tax -0.469  < 2e-16   ***
#>       nox -0.427  < 2e-16   ***
#>      crim -0.388  < 2e-16   ***
#>       age -0.377  < 2e-16   ***
#>        zn  0.360  < 2e-16   ***
#>     black  0.333 1.32e-14   ***
#>       dis  0.250 1.21e-08   ***

# Summarize results in words
summary(x)
#> Correlating medv with crim zn indus nox rm age dis tax ptratio black lstat 
#> The median absolute correlation was -0.388 with a range from -0.738 to 0.695 
#>  11 out of 11 variables were significant at the p < 0.05 level.

# Plot results
plot(x)
